title: Siegel wins 7-AAA tournament title
text:
Siegel wins 7-AAA tournament title Corby A. Yarbrough, DNJ Correspondent 10:27 p.m. CDT October 8, 2015 Siegel’s Hannah Adams spikes the ball between the hands of Blackman’s Maddie Lee and Hailey Ivy. (Photo: Jim Davis/DNJ) CONNECT 14 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
SMYRNA —There was no blemish on perfection this time around for Siegel. 
The Lady Stars' volleyball team captured its fifth straight District 7-AAA Tournament title with a three-game sweep over Blackman Thursday night at Stewarts Creek. 
The 25-12, 25-19, 25-18 win capped off a run through the district season where Siegel did not drop a single game. The Lady Stars were in the same scenario in last year's finals against Blackman before dropping their only district game (20-25) of the year. 
History looked ready to repeat itself in game three again Thursday. Blackman took its first lead of the match at 2-1 and led five times, including a three-point lead at 10-7, before Siegel reeled off a 10-0 run to help secure another championship. 
“(Siegel coach Shawn Robinson) has been on me this whole year about tempo, tempo, tempo. It's playing our game instead of playing down to the speed of the other team. In (game three) we set the pace of the game,” said tournament and regular season MVP Kristin Demonbreun. 
The senior had five of her 33 assists during the run. “That starts with the pass, then it goes to me, and then it goes to the hitters. We've all got to do our job and it's really all about the tempo that gets us going.” 
Junior Leah Poarch collected three kills and a block during the crucial run to help close out the match. 
“We knew that we had to push and finish,” Poarch said. “Since it was a tie game it was pretty much like starting 0-0 and just a quick game to 15. We just had to get the lead quick and fight.” 
The Lady Stars jumped out to a 7-1 lead to open the match and closed out the first game with a 14-4 run. Blackman kept it closer in the second game, including a 13-13 tie, but Siegel scored seven of the game's final eight points for the 2-0 lead. 
“We tried composing ourselves and tried to stay positive more than negative and didn't focus on individuals; we were more of a team,” Blackman senior Tristyn Lozano said. “We kind of just got drained (after the 10-7 lead in game three). We were making mistake after mistake and we thought it was over, and then toward the end we realized it was not over and we decided to push. But by that time it was too late.” 
Siegel will play host to a Region 4-AAA semifinal against the Columbia-Livingston Academy loser, while Blackman will travel to the winner for its region match. The semifinal winners secure a spot in the sectional round. The Lady Stars are going for their third straight region title. 
Siegel advanced to the finals after a 25-13, 25-22, 25-14 win against host Stewarts Creek, while third-seeded Blackman dropped the first game against second-seeded Riverdale before winning the next three (24-26, 28-26, 25-23, 25-20). Read or Share this story: http://on.dnj.com/1Ll3AgG TOP VIDEOS
